result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Anthony Vargas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay any mandatory costs and any other costs and disbursements related to this case due on or before 07-22-2016. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 35 days TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Anthony Vargas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 35 days TIME SERVED.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to pay any mandatory costs and any other costs and disbursements related to this case due on or before 07-22-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Michael Anthony Vargas in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant in custody. Student intern Morgan Wilz appearing with Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Michael Anthony Vargas not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Defense counsel requests a status conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Michael Anthony Vargas in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Michael Anthony Vargas in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
